summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel in New York, arranging a meeting for agents to observe a taint review process related to an investigation, likely connected to the Epstein case. It is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Heys
persons.context: FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, who initiates the email to arrange for agents to observe a taint review process.

events.title: Planned Taint Review Demonstration
events.description: FBI agents plan to visit to observe the taint review process, as arranged via email.

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email chain dated July 14, 2020, arranging a demonstration of a 'taint review process' for agents.
The correspondence involves the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit.
The document is explicitly marked as 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' for specific paragraphs, indicating sensitive or restricted information.
The email participants' addresses are redacted, showing only their roles (NY CART Coordinator, Senior Forensic Examiner, Special Agent).
The primary identifiable individual is Special Agent Heys, who works on child exploitation and human trafficking cases.
